Alibaba.passage: Alibaba is a 2003 Indian Hindi-language action drama film directed by Rajkumar Santoshi. It stars Amitabh Bachchan, Rani Mukerji and Aamir Khan, with supporting roles played by Paresh Rawal, Raima Sen, Om Puri and Gulshan Grover. The film's music is by A. R. Rahman and cinematography is by A. Sreekar Prasad. Alibaba and the Forty Thieves is a folk tale of a thief who adopts a baby boy, renames him Ali Baba, and raises him as their own. Ali Baba grows up to become a master thief in the city of Shibin, only to be outwitted by a policeman. The policeman is killed by Ali Baba, who is then arrested and sentenced to death. He manages to escape and, with the aid of his childhood friend, a young woman named Farah, he sets out to find the forty thieves and exact revenge on them. Alibaba is based on the story of Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves, a well-known folk tale found in One Thousand and One Nights. The film was announced in 1998 and was initially set to be produced by Yash Raj Films. It was later produced by Vijay Singh's VIVA Entertainment. The film was shot in locations including Morocco, Turkey and Italy.

Apple.passage: Apple Inc. is an American multinational technology company headquartered in Cupertino, California, United States. Apple is the largest technology company by revenue (totaling US$365.8 billion in 2021) and, as of June 2022, is the world's biggest company by market capitalization, the fourth-largest personal computer vendor by unit sales and second-largest mobile phone manufacturer. It is one of the Big Five American information technology companies, alongside Alphabet (Google), Amazon, Meta (Facebook), and Microsoft.Apple was founded as Apple Computer Company on April 1,1976, by Steve Wozniak, Steve Jobs and Ronald Wayne to develop and sell Wozniak's Apple I personal computer. It was incorporated by Jobs and Wozniak as Apple Computer, Inc. in 1977 and the company's next computer, the Apple II, became a best seller and one of the first mass-produced microcomputers. Apple went public in 1980 to instant financial success. The company developed computers featuring innovative graphical user interfaces, including the 1984 original Macintosh, announced that year in a critically acclaimed advertisement. By 1985, the high cost of its products and power struggles between executives caused problems.

Boston Consulting Group.passage:
Boston Consulting Group (BCG) is an American management consulting firm with over 100 offices in more than 40 countries. It is one of the Big Four management consulting firms along with McKinsey & Company, Bain & Company, and Deloitte Consulting, and is considered a leader in strategy consulting and corporate consulting. [citation needed] BCG was founded in 1963 by Bruce Henderson and partner David J. Chynoweth, who had met as graduate students at Harvard Business School. The company is organized around two global consulting networks, one for strategy consulting and one for corporate consulting. It is led by the firm's managing partner, and is composed of approximately 20,000 consultants. In 2017 BCG generated $3.7 billion in revenue, with profits of $865 million. The company has a large presence in many of the Fortune 500 companies, and is ranked as the second largest management consulting firm in the world by revenue. [1]
It has been listed in the Consulting magazine's list of the \"World's Most Innovative Companies\" every year since 2012, ranking first in 2017 and second in 2015. The firm was founded in 1963 by two Harvard Business School graduates, Bruce Henderson and David J.
Chynoweth. Henderson was the firm's first managing partner and led the organization for the first 20 years of its existence. He was succeeded in 1983 by Michael J.

China Construction Bank.passage: China Construction Bank (CCB; Chinese: 中国建设银行; pinyin: Zhōngguó Jiànshè Yínháng) is a Chinese bank headquartered in Beijing. It is one of the Big Four banks of China, alongside Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China, and Bank of China. The bank was founded in 1952 as the first nationalized commercial bank in China. It is the largest bank in China by assets, and was ranked as the largest bank in Asia in 2019 by total assets. It has over 1,000 domestic offices and branches, and over 1,200 foreign representative offices and subsidiaries in more than 50 countries and regions. The bank is owned by the People's Republic of China and governed by the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission. The bank is one of the few financial institutions in the world with a PBC charter, which gives the bank a special legal status. The bank is also one of the first banks in the world to receive a PBC banking license. The bank's primary business is lending and deposit-taking, with a focus on providing financing for infrastructure projects. It is also a major provider of foreign exchange and money market products and services in China and a global leader in trade and treasury management. The bank is also one of the largest providers of consumer financing in China and a leading provider of wealth management services.

qae_pairs.explanation: Steve Wozniak attended Homestead High School in Cupertino, California.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the city where Steve Wozniak was born?
qae_pairs.explanation: Steve Wozniak was born in Cupertino, California.

the Federal Reserve.passage: The Federal Reserve System is an independent federal agency created by the U.S. Congress in 1913 during the Progressive Era to provide the nation with a safer, more flexible, and more stable monetary and financial system. It consists of several institutions, including the Board of Governors, the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), and the twelve regional Federal Reserve Banks, which serve both public and private sectors as the nation's central bank and financial regulator.

qae_pairs.question: Which year was the Federal Reserve created?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Federal Reserve System was created in 1913.

qae_pairs.question: Which of the following is not a correct statement about the Federal Reserve?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Federal Reserve System is an independent federal agency created by the U.S. Congress in 1913 during the Progressive Era to provide the nation with a safer, more flexible, and more stable monetary and financial system.

qae_pairs.question: Which of the following is not a correct statement about the Federal Reserve System?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Federal Reserve System was created during the Progressive Era.

the Office of the Comptroller of the Cur.term: the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency
the Office of the Comptroller of the Cur.passage: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) is a United States independent agency that regulates national banks and federal savings associations. The OCC is an agency of the United States federal government. It is headed by a Comptroller of the Currency. The OCC is a bureau of the United States Department of the Treasury. It is housed in Washington, D.C. The OCC was created on June 3, 1863, under an act of Congress. The OCC is an independent bureau of the United States Department of the Treasury. It is headed by a Comptroller of the Currency, appointed by the president with the consent of the United States Senate. The Comptroller of the Currency serves as the head of the OCC, and is the chief banking regulator for federally chartered banks and federal savings associations. The OCC is a federal agency that regulates national banks, federal branches, and federal savings associations, including their holding companies, and the federal branches and federal savings associations of foreign banks. The OCC supervises approximately 8,000 state member banks and federal branches, and federal savings associations. The Comptroller of the Currency is the chief executive of the OCC, and the head of the federal banking system.

qae_pairs.question: What year was the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency created?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency was created on June 3, 1863, under an act of Congress.

qae_pairs.question: What is the location of the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency is an independent agency that regulates national banks and federal savings associations. It is located in Washington, D.C.

qae_pairs.question: What is the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency a part of?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency is a part of the United States Department of the Treasury.

hops: the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

the Prudential Regulation Authority.passage: Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) is a non-ministerial UK government body that regulates the UK insurance industry. It was established in 2012 as a successor to the Financial Services Authority. It was formed by the Financial Services and Markets Act of 2000 and is based at 25 Victoria Street in London.

qae_pairs.question: What year was the Prudential Regulation Authority formed?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Prudential Regulation Authority was formed in 2012 as a successor to the Financial Services Authority.

qae_pairs.question: Which act established the Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA)?
qae_pairs.answer: the Financial Services and Markets Act
qae_pairs.explanation: The Prudential Regulation Authority (PRA) is a non-ministerial UK government body that regulates the UK insurance industry. It was established in 2012 as a successor to the Financial Services Authority. It was formed by the Financial Services and Markets Act of 2000 and is based at 25 Victoria Street in London.

qae_pairs.question: What is the location of the Prudential Regulation Authority?
qae_pairs.explanation: The Prudential Regulation Authority is based in London.

London.passage: London (UK: /ˈlʌndən/ LUND, US: /ˈlʌndən/ LUND; Scottish Gaelic: "Lùndain" ( listen)), officially the City of London, is the capital city of England and of the United Kingdom. It is the largest city in both the United Kingdom and England. With a population of 9.7 million residents in 2017, London is also the most populous city proper in the European Union. London has been a major settlement for two millennia. It is one of the world's most significant global cities, and has the fifth- or sixth-largest metropolitan area GDP (depending on calculation method) in the world (globally, it is the world's fourth-largest city by GDP). London is a leading global city, hosting the headquarters of many major international companies and organisations, and is one of the world's leading financial centres. London is a top international tourist destination, ranked as the most visited city in the world in 2013 and 2014, and the largest city in the world by urban area. It has been ranked as the most expensive city in the world in which to live or visit. London's many universities make it one of the world's top research and education centres, drawing students from around the world, and making it a global centre for business and finance.

qae_pairs.question: How many years has London been a major settlement?
qae_pairs.explanation: London has been a major settlement for two millennia.

qae_pairs.question: What is the year that London was ranked as the most visited city in the world?
qae_pairs.explanation: London was ranked as the most visited city in the world in 2013.

qae_pairs.question: What is the capital of the country that London is in?
qae_pairs.explanation: London is the capital city of the United Kingdom.

Michael Bloomberg.passage: Michael Bloomberg (born February 14, 1942) is an American businessman and philanthropist who served as the 108th Mayor of New York City, a position he held from 2002 to 2013. He is a member of the Democratic Party.

qae_pairs.question: What is Michael Bloomberg's position?
qae_pairs.explanation: Michael Bloomberg is a former mayor of New York City. He was elected in 2001 and served until 2013.

qae_pairs.question: What is the date of birth of Michael Bloomberg?
qae_pairs.explanation: Michael Bloomberg was born on February 14, 1942.

Harvard Business School.passage: Harvard Business School (HBS) is an American graduate business school of Harvard University. Founded in 1908 as the Harvard School of Business, it was the first American school to offer a Master of Business Administration degree when it did so in 1908. It was also the first to offer the degree on a full-time, residential, and degree-granting basis. HBS is consistently ranked as one of the top business schools in the world.

qae_pairs.question: What year did Harvard Business School start?
qae_pairs.explanation: Harvard Business School was founded in 1908.

qae_pairs.question: What is Harvard Business School?
qae_pairs.explanation: Harvard Business School (HBS) is an American graduate business school of Harvard University.

Bruce Henderson.passage: Bruce Henderson (born July 22, 1949) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey player who played for the Philadelphia Flyers, Pittsburgh Penguins, Toronto Maple Leafs, and Washington Capitals in the National Hockey League (NHL). He is currently an analyst for the NHL Network. Henderson was a two-time Stanley Cup champion, winning the Conn Smythe Trophy as playoff MVP in 1981 with the Penguins and the Conn Smythe Trophy again in 1992 with the Maple Leafs.

qae_pairs.question: What date is Bruce Henderson's birthday?
qae_pairs.explanation: Bruce Henderson was born on July 22, 1949.

qae_pairs.question: What is the year that Bruce Henderson won the Conn Smythe Trophy?
qae_pairs.explanation: Bruce Henderson won the Conn Smythe Trophy in 1981 and 1992.

qae_pairs.question: How many years after winning the Stanley Cup did Bruce Henderson win the Conn Smythe Trophy?
qae_pairs.explanation: Bruce Henderson won the Conn Smythe Trophy in 1992, two years after winning the Stanley Cup with the Toronto Maple Leafs.

Michael J.passage: Michael J. Fox (born Michael Andrew Fox; July 26, 1961) is an American actor, film producer, and activist. He is best known for his starring role as Alex P. Keaton on the NBC sitcom Family Ties (1982–1989), for which he received two Emmy Awards and a Golden Globe Award, and for his portrayal of Marty McFly in the Back to the Future trilogy (1985–1990).

qae_pairs.question: What is Michael J. Fox's character's name in Back to the Future?
qae_pairs.explanation: Michael J. Fox played Marty McFly in the Back to the Future trilogy.

Paribas.passage: Paribas (pronounced [parʁiˈbas]) ( /ˈpærɪbɑːs/) is one of the five main French banks, alongside Société Générale, Crédit agricole, BNP Paribas and Natixis. It is the second largest bank in France, after BNP Paribas, and the largest bank in Europe by market capitalization.

qae_pairs.question: Which French bank is larger than Paribas and is a competitor to Société Générale?
qae_pairs.explanation: Société Générale

qae_pairs.question: Which country does Paribas have operations in?
qae_pairs.explanation: Paribas is a French bank that has operations in France.

Paris.passage: Paris (pronounced /ˈpærɪsi/ (help·info)) is the capital and most populous city of France. It has an area of 105 km2 (41 sq mi) and a population of 2,251,621 (in 2013) within its administrative limits. The city is located in the north of the country on the river Seine, in the centre of the Île-de-France region, and at the heart of the Île-de-France administrative region. The city is also the centre of the Paris Region, one of the largest urban areas in the European Union. Paris' inhabitants are called Parisians (French: Parisiens), and the city is also referred to as the City of Light. The city is renowned for its culture, fashion, art, science, and cuisine. It hosts many world-renowned monuments and museums, including the Louvre (world's largest museum), Notre Dame (cathedral of the French Catholic Church), the Eiffel Tower, and the Basilica of Sacré-Cœur, which houses one of the largest congregations of Christ the Light. In addition to its historical and cultural significance, Paris is also the center of the French economy and government. It is the largest city in the European Union by population (following London), and the second largest city in the world, after Tokyo.

qae_pairs.question: Which country is home to the city of Paris?
qae_pairs.explanation: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

qae_pairs.question: What is the name of the religious organization that is the largest in Paris?
qae_pairs.explanation: The largest religious organization in Paris is the French Catholic Church.

qae_pairs.question: What is the largest river in Paris?
qae_pairs.explanation: The largest river in Paris is the Seine.

Beijing.passage: Beijing (simplified Chinese: 北京; traditional Chinese: 北京; pinyin: Běijing) is the capital of the People's Republic of China (PRC) and the world's second most populous city proper, after Shanghai. Beijing is one of the world's most important cities, and a major center of culture, politics and industry. It has been a global city since the 19th century. Beijing is one of the oldest cities in the world, with a long history dating back three millennia, as one of the seven ancient capitals of China. Beijing is governed as a sub-national municipality, and the Beijing municipality administers 12 districts, four county-level cities and five other urban districts, in addition to a number of suburban counties. Beijing's status as a world city is evidenced by its designation as a global city. The city is one of the most significant national and international centers of politics, economy, culture and education. It is the political, cultural, and economic center of the People's Republic of China, and functions as a global city, hosting the headquarters of many of the world's largest companies. Beijing has been ranked as the world's second best city to live in by the Globalization and World Cities Research Network, and as the fifth most expensive city in the world by the International Monetary Fund.

qae_pairs.question: What is the official name of the country that Beijing is the capital of?
qae_pairs.explanation: The People's Republic of China

qae_pairs.question: How old is Beijing?
qae_pairs.explanation: Beijing is one of the oldest cities in the world, with a long history dating back three millennia, as one of the seven ancient capitals of China.

qae_pairs.question: Which organization is not based in Beijing?
qae_pairs.explanation: World Cities Research Network

Asia.passage: Asia covers 6,826,400 square kilometres (2,590,400 sq mi) and has a population of 4.58 billion. It comprises the continental landmass of Eurasia and the Indian subcontinent. Asia is bounded by the Pacific Ocean on the east; by the Atlantic Ocean and the Indian Ocean on the south; by the Arctic Ocean on the north; and by Africa and the Atlantic Ocean on the west. The largest continent, Asia covers more than 30% of Earth's total land area and about 20% of its total surface area.

qae_pairs.question: Which ocean is located to the east of Asia?
qae_pairs.explanation: Asia is located on the eastern side of the Pacific Ocean.

the China Banking and Insurance Regulato.term: the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission
the China Banking and Insurance Regulato.passage: The China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission (CBIRC, Chinese: 中国银保监察部), formerly known as the China Securities Regulatory Commission, is an agency of the Central Government of the People's Republic of China that is in charge of regulating banking and insurance industries in Mainland China. The CBIRC was established on June 30, 2007, and is headquartered in Beijing.

qae_pairs.question: What is the headquarters location of China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission?
qae_pairs.explanation: The China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission (CBIRC, Chinese: 中国银保监察部), formerly known as the China Securities Regulatory Commission, is an agency of the Central Government of the People's Republic of China that is in charge of regulating banking and insurance industries in Mainland China. The CBIRC was established on June 30, 2007, and is headquartered in Beijing.

qae_pairs.question: What year was the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission established?
qae_pairs.explanation: The China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission was established on June 30, 2007.

hops: the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission
